title: Patient Name
instruction: Only return the patients name and not the doctors name or anyone else's name

title: Chief Complaint
instruction: State the patient's chief complaint clearly and concisely. Avoid direct speech, additional context, or unrelated comments.

title: History of Present Illness
content: She reports persistent arm stiffness and discomfort since surgery. Symptoms have improved with reduced numbness and tingling, though she still experiences difficulty placing her hand flat on the ground. Physical exam reveals mild scarring and pillar pain without painful active extension. Mild discomfort persists during activities requiring hands-on-the-ground placement.
instruction: Provide a structured summary of the patient's illness. Include symptom onset, duration, severity, exacerbating/relieving factors, and past treatments. Avoid direct speech, filler words, or first-person phrasing. End each sentence with a period and ensure medical terminology and grammar are correct.

title: Past Medical History
instruction: Include prior diagnoses, surgeries, hospitalizations unrelated to the current issue. Do not include current complaints or the doctorâ€™s current plan. Maintain a professional tone and correct grammar.

title: Current Medications
instruction: List current medications with name (generic and brand), dose, route, frequency, and duration. Format clearly. If none, use the default.

title: Family History
instruction: Mention relevant family conditions. Specify relationship and age at diagnosis if known. If no family history is stated, return the default.

title: Social History
instruction: Include information on occupation, living situation, habits (smoking, alcohol, drug use), sexual history if relevant. Use professional language.

title: Allergies
instruction: Include medication, food, or environmental allergies mentioned. If none are noted, return the default.

title: HEENT
default: Eyes: No visual loss, blurred vision, double vision. Ears, Nose, Throat: No hearing loss, sneezing, congestion, runny nose or sore throat.
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no relevant information is found in the transcript. Do not fabricate details.

title: Skin
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no specific findings are mentioned. Avoid assumptions.

title: CARDIOVASCULAR
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no cardiovascular complaints or findings are present in transcript.

title: Respiratory
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no respiratory symptoms are mentioned.

instruction: Return 'Normal' if no neurological issues are described.

title: Constitutional
instruction: Return 'Normal' if no constitutional symptoms like fever, fatigue, or weight change are mentioned.

title: MUSCULOSKELETAL
content: Mild pillar pain, no painful active extension

title: Neurological
instruction: Return 'Normal' unless PE findings specific to neurological system are noted.

title: Immunizations
instruction: Document any vaccinations mentioned, including date and type. Use the default if none are mentioned.

title: Lab Results
instruction: Include only completed lab tests. Do not list future or recommended labs. Mention type of test, date, and result. Do not repeat diagnosis here.

title: Assessment and Plan
content: The patient demonstrates improvement in arm function with decreased numbness and tingling compared to previous visits. However, there remains mild discomfort during certain movements such as placing hands flat on the ground. The physical exam shows mild scarring and pillar pain without painful active extension. Overall, the patient's recovery trajectory aligns with expectations post-surgery. Moving forward, I recommend continuing with a home exercise program targeting pillar pain management while maintaining high levels of activity. Follow-up appointments should occur every three months to monitor progress and adjust care plans accordingly.
instruction: Provide structured diagnosis, reasoning, and a treatment plan. Exclude any follow-up instructions. Do not include SOAP_FOLLOW_UP info here. Maintain clinical tone.

title: Follow Up
content: Every three months for monitoring progress and adjusting care plans.
Continue with home exercise program targeting pillar pain management.
instruction: Document follow-up timing, purpose, and review plan. Do not repeat the assessment or plan section.
